DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text description of the current status of a woman's use of hormone replacement therapy after menopause.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person's history of treatment with estrogens or estrogen/progesterone after menopause or ovariectomy to prevent pathological effects of decreased estrogen production.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: RAEB: Treatment with estrogens or estrogen/progesterone after menopause or ovariectomy to prevent pathological effects of decreased estrogen production.

Concepts.definition: Treatment with estrogens or estrogen/progesterone after menopause or ovariectomy to prevent pathological effects of decreased estrogen production.

Property.preferredDefinition: an account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced.

Concepts.definition: A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the patient's ability to conceive or nurse offspring and/or their current reproductive status.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The permanent cessation of menses, usually defined by 6 to 12 months of amenorrhea in a woman over 45 years of age._Various treatment modalities that produce the desired therapeutic effect by means of change of hormone/hormones level. The treatment may include administration of hormones or hormone analogs to the patient, or decreasing the level of hormones in the body by using hormone antagonists, or hormone ablation therapy._A condition or state at a particular time.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Yes, I have taken menopausal hormone therapy in the past, but no longer do.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the patient's ability to conceive or nurse offspring and/or their current reproductive status.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The permanent cessation of menses, usually defined by 6 to 12 months of amenorrhea in a woman over 45 years of age.:Various treatment modalities that produce the desired therapeutic effect by means of change of hormone/hormones level. The treatment may include administration of hormones or hormone analogs to the patient, or decreasing the level of hormones in the body by using hormone antagonists, or hormone ablation therapy. The concept covers but not limited to: intermittent or permanent hormone suppression or ablation in treatment of hormone-dependent tumors, hormone replacement therapy of any kind, hormonal component of gender reassignment therapy, hormonal contraception, surgical and radiation castration.:A condition or state at a particular time.

Concepts.definition: The permanent cessation of menses, usually defined by 6 to 12 months of amenorrhea in a woman over 45 years of age.
Various treatment modalities that produce the desired therapeutic effect by means of change of hormone/hormones level.
A condition or state at a particular time.
